page.title: 10Local History
page.content: {Local History {Richard Carter A Flockton-born benefactor of Flockton he entered the coal industry in the early years of the 17th century, and eventually owned his own mine. As a result of his success he was able to build in the 1690's a chapel. In his will, he provided an endowment of the chapel for a minister; the building of three almshouses, and also an endowment on the school already existing. The almshouses and school still exist, and the endowments he made have had a significant influence on the life of the church and school for many years, although being of fixed amounts they are now worth very little. { New Hall Farm}is on the site of New Hall which may have been a 13th cent. manor. There is evidence of a moat.
